member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions
member.summary: Enumerates what to do on different FlexCel error situations.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.None
member.summary: FlexCel will try to recover from most errors.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnTooManyPageBreaks
member.summary: When true and the number of manual pagebreaks is bigger than the maximum Excel allows, an Exception will be raised. When false, the page break will be silently omitted. Note that This exception is raised when saving the file as xls, when you are exporting your report to PDF or images, all page breaks will be used.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnFormulaConstantTooLong
member.summary:
When true, FlexCel will complain when you try to set a formula that has a string constant bigger than 255 characters.
For example, the formula: '="very long string that has more than 255 characters...." & "other string" ' would raise an Exception, since Excel won't allow it. Note that you can still use ' =a1 & "other string" ' where the cell A1 has the value: "very long string that has more than 255 characters....". this restriction applies only to inline strings.
Note that when this property is false you will still get the error, but only when saving to xls, xlsx or other file formats that don't support longer strings. (this error is too important to be ignored)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnRowHeightTooBig
member.summary: When true and the row height is bigger than the maximum allowed by Excel, you will get an Exception.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnXlsxInvalidName
member.summary: If this is true and the xlsx file contains an invalid name, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnXlsxMissingPart
member.summary: If this is true and the xlsx file contains a missing part (like an image), an exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnXlsxInvalidFormula
member.summary: If this is true and the file contains an invalid formula, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnXlsxInvalidHyperlink
member.summary: If this is true and the file contains invalid hyperlinks, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.All
member.summary: Sets all error actions together.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TWorkspace
member.summary:
This class links together a group of spreadsheets, so you can recalculate among linked spreadsheets. In order to use it, just define an object of this class and add all the files you need for the linked recalculation. If you don't know in advance which files you will need, you can use the event.
Note that whenever you recalculate any file in the workspace, all files will be recalculated, so you don't need to calculate them twice.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TWorkspace.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new workspace.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TWorkspace.Add(System.String,FlexCel.Core.ExcelFile)
member.summary: Adds a file to the workspace. Whenever you recalculate any file in this workspace, all linked files will be recalculated too. Note that you can't add two files with the same name or same reference twice to this collection.
member.param: Name that this file will have in the workspace. When recalculating a linked formula, this name will be used. If you want to include paths in the name you can too, but it is normally not needed since FlexCel will search for the simple filename anyway. You only need to include paths if you have 2 files with the same name in different folders used in the recalculation.
Excel file to add.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TWorkspace.Count
member.summary: Number of linked files in this workspace.

member.summary: Returns the file at index.
member.param: Index of the file in the workspace. (1 based)

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TWorkspace.Clear
member.summary: Removes all files from the workspace.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TWorkspace.Recalc(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use this method to force a recalculation of all the spreadsheets in the workspace. This is the same as calling Recalc() in any of the files in the workspace.
member.param: When true this method will perform a recalc in all files. When false, it will only recalculate the files where there has been a change.

member.returns: A list with the unsupported functions in the workspace.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TTableDefinition.ColumnFromName(System.String,FlexCel.Core.ExcelFile,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the column definition for a given column name. If tableXls is null, then this method will return the stored column name. If not null and the table has headers, this method will try to get the column name from the cell value of the table headers in the Excel file.
If the column name doesn't exist, this method will return a TTableColumnDefinition(null, -1);
member.param: Column name which we want to find.

ExcelFile which contains the table. It can be null, and in this case the stored value of the header will be used. If not null, we will read the actual cell value in the file for the header, and return that.
Sheet where the table is inside tableXls (1 based).

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts
member.summary: Utility methods and constants usable anywhere.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.DefColWidthAdapt
member.summary:
OBSOLETE: Use instead.
Multiply by this number to convert the DEFAULT column width to pixels. This is different from , that goes in a column by column basis.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Columns97_2003
member.summary: Maximum column on an xls (Excel 97 - 2003) spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 255)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Columns2007
member.summary: Maximum column on an xlsx (Excel 2007 and up) spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 16383)

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Columns
member.summary:
Maximum column in the spreadsheet. (0 based). Note that this number is 1 less than the maximum column count, because this value is 0-based. You can use to get the number of columns instead.
This number might be 255 if is TExcelVersion.v97_2003 or 16383 otherwise.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.MaxRowCount
member.summary:
Returns the maximum number of rows that you can have in a spreadsheet. This is the same as + 1.
This number might be 65536 if is TExcelVersion.v97_2003 or 1048576 otherwise.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.MaxColCount
member.summary:
Returns the maximum number of columns that you can have in a spreadsheet. This is the same as + 1.
This number might be 256 if is TExcelVersion.v97_2003 or 16384 otherwise.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Rows97_2003
member.summary: Maximum row on an xls (Excel 97 - 2003) spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 65535)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Rows95
member.summary: Maximum row on an xls (Excel 2 - 95) spreadsheet. (0 based)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Rows2007
member.summary: Maximum row on an xlsx (Excel 2007 and up) spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 1048575)

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Rows
member.summary:
Maximum row in the spreadsheet. (0 based). Note that this number is 1 less than the maximum row count, because this value is 0-based. You can use to get the number of columns instead.
This number might be 65535 if is TExcelVersion.v97_2003 or 1048575 otherwise.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Sheets
member.summary: Maximum sheet on a spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 65530)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_PxlColumns
member.summary: Maximum column on Pocket Excel a spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 255)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_PxlRows
member.summary: Maximum row on a Pocket Excel spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 16383)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_PxlSheets
member.summary: Maximum sheet on a Pocket Excel spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 255)

member.summary: Number of letters in a column name. This is 2 in xls97 (columns go up to IV) and 3 in xls2007 (columns go up to XFD)

member.summary: String used to separate 2 objects on an object path.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.ObjectPathAbsolute
member.summary: When an objpath starts with this character, it is an absolute path that includes the object index. If it doesn't start with it, then the ObjPath doesn't include the original object.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.ObjectPathObjName
member.summary: When an objpath starts with this character, it is a path that goes directly to the name of an object. Note that when more than an object have the same name in the same sheet, this path won't work and you will have to use absolute or relative ones.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.ObjectPathSpId
member.summary: When an objpath starts with this character, what follows is a single shape id that identifies the object.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType
member.summary: Possible image types on an excel sheet.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Emf
member.summary: Enhanced Windows Metafile. This is a Vectorial image format.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Wmf
member.summary: Windows Metafile. This is a Vectorial image format.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Jpeg
member.summary: JPEG Image. This is a lossy compressed bitmap, best suited for photos.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Png
member.summary: Portable Network Graphics. This is a lossless compressed bitmap, best suited for text.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Bmp
member.summary: Windows Bitmap. As this is not compressed, don't use it except for really small images.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Pict
member.summary: Macintosh PICT. This won't be rendered by FlexCel, and you shouldn't add images in this format.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Tiff
member.summary: Tiff Image: This is NOT supported in xls file format, only xlsx.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Gif
member.summary: Gif Image. This is NOT supported in xls file format, only xlsx.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Unknown
member.summary: Unsupported image format.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions
member.summary: General options for a sheet. In Excel, this settings are located in Tools->Options->View in the "Window options" box. Most of this options can be set with dedicated methods in , but this type allows to set them all at once, or copy them from other file. This options apply only to the active sheet. For options that apply to all the sheets see

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.None
member.summary: No option is selected.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.ShowFormulaText
member.summary: If 1, Excel will show formula text instead of formula results. This is the same as calling

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.ShowGridLines
member.summary: If 0 Excel will hide the gridlines, if 1 it will show them. This is the same as calling

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.ShowRowAndColumnHeaders
member.summary: if 0 Excel will hide the "A", "B"... column headers and "1", "2" ... row Headers.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.ZeroValues
member.summary: If 1 Excel will hide 0 values. This is the same as calling

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.AutomaticGridLineColors
member.summary: If 1, the color of gridlines will be gray. If 0 it will be the color specified at . Note that calling will automatically set this property to 0.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.RightToLeft
member.summary: If 1, the sheet is Right to left.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.OutlineSymbols
member.summary: If 1, Excel will show the outline symbols (+/-) when there are gouped rows or columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.PageBreakView
member.summary: If 1 Excel will show the page breaks.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions
member.summary: General options for how sheets display. In Excel, this settings are located in Tools->Options->View in the "Window options" box. This options apply only to all the sheets. For options that apply only to the active sheet see

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.None
member.summary: No option is selected.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.HideWindow
member.summary: If true, the workbook window will be hidden. You will need to go to Window->Unhide to see it.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.MinimizeWindow
member.summary: If true, the workbok window will be minimized.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.ShowHorizontalScrollBar
member.summary: If false, the horizontal scroll bar will be hidden.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.ShowVerticalScrollBar
member.summary: If false, the vertical scroll bar will be hidden.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.ShowSheetTabBar
member.summary: If false, the bar with sheet names at the bottom will be hidden.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged
member.summary: Specifies how a merged cell will be autofitted. For example, if you have a merged cell from row 1 to 4, You might want to increase the size of the first row, the second, the last, or every row a little.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.None
member.summary: Merged cells with more than one row will not be autofitted when autofitting rows, and merged cells with more than one column will not be autofitted when autofitting rows.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnLastCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the last row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the last column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnLastCellMinusOne
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the row before the last row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the column before the last column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnLastCellMinusTwo
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of 2 rows before the last row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or 2 columns before the last column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnLastCellMinusThree
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of 3 rows before the last row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or 3 columns before the last column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnLastCellMinusFour
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of 4 rows before the last row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or 4 columns before the last column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnFirstCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the first row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the first column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnSecondCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the second row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the second column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnThirdCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the third row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the third column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnFourthCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the fourth row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the fourth column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnFifthCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the fifth row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the fifth column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.Balanced
member.summary: Autofit will change the height every row in the merged cell by the same amount.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords
member.summary: A list of records that might not be saved into a file when using

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.None
member.summary: This includes all records, including the write access. It is not recommended to use this setting, because write access will change every time you save a file with a different user.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.WriteAccess
member.summary: This is a stamp that is saved to the file each time it is saved, identifying the current user. You normally won't want to save this record, so you should specify this value.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.CellSelection
member.summary: If you specify CellSelection, the selected cells will be ignored.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.SheetSelected
member.summary: If you specify SheetSelected, the active sheet will be ignored.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.Version
member.summary: If you specify Version, the version of Excel used to save the file will be ignored. (Note that version might change in an Excel Service Pack).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.All
member.summary: This excludes all records in this enumeration. This is the most recommended option.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions
member.summary: How the sheet should be printed. You can mix value together by and'ing and or'ing the flags. See the example to see how to set or clear one specific value of the enumeration.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.None
member.summary: All options cleared.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.LeftToRight
member.summary: Print over, then down

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.Orientation
member.summary: 0= landscape, 1=portrait. You can change this by using xls.PrintLandscape.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.NoPls
member.summary: if 1, then PaperSize, Scale, Res, VRes, Copies, and Landscape data have not been obtained from the printer, so they are not valid. MAKE SURE YOU MAKE THIS BIT = 0 *BEFORE* CHANGING ANY OTHER OPTION. THEY WILL NOT CHANGE IF THIS IS NOT SET.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.NoColor
member.summary: 1= Black and white

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.Draft
member.summary: 1= Draft quality

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.Notes
member.summary: 1= Print Notes

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.NoOrient
member.summary: 1=orientation not set

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.UsePage
member.summary: 1=use custom starting page number.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects
member.summary: Enumeration defining which objects should not be printed or exported to pdf. You can 'or' more than one option together. For example, to not print images and not comments, you should specify: THidePrintObjects.Images | THidePrintOption.Comments

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects.None
member.summary: Print and Export everything.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects.Images
member.summary: Do not print or export images to pdf.

member.summary: Do not export Comments to pdf.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects.Hyperlynks
member.summary: Do not export Hyperlinks to pdf.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects.Headers
member.summary: Do not print or export to pdf the Headers.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects.Footers
member.summary: Do not print or export to pdf the Footers.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects.HeadersAndFooters
member.summary: Do not export headers nor footers. This is the same as specifying TPrintOptions.Headers and TPrintOptions.Footers.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects.PageBreaks
member.summary: Do not export page breaks. This property only applies to html exports.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TExcelVersion
member.summary: Defines which Excel version FlexCel is targeting. Note that while on v2007 you still can make xls 97 spreadsheets.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelVersion.v2007
member.summary: Excel 2007 and up. This version has a grid of 1048576 rows x 16384 columns.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelVersion.v97_2003
member.summary: Versions from Excel 97 to Excel 2003. Those versions have a grid limited by 65536 rows x 255 columns.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat
member.summary: Different Excel versions create different empty xls/xlsx files. For example an empty xls file created by Excel 2003 will have "Arial" as its default font, and one created by Excel 2007 will have "Calibri". By default, when you call FlexCel will create a file that is similar to what Excel 2003 would create. This is fine, but if you want to start for example from an empty Excel 2007 file, you can do so by calling NewFile() with this enumeration.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2003
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2003. The default font is Arial.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2007
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2007. The default font is Calibri.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2010
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2010. The default font is Calibri.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2013
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2013. The default font is Calibri.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2016
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2016. The default font is Calibri.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TXlsBiffVersion
member.summary: The specific Excel version that FlexCel will emulate when reading and saving files.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsBiffVersion.Excel2007
member.summary: FlexCel will identify itself as Excel 2007 in the generated xls files.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TXlsBiffVersion.Excel2003
member.summary: FlexCel will identify itself as Excel 2003 in the generated xls files. It will also ignore the extra information written by Excel 2007 when reading xls files created with it.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TFileFormats
member.summary: Supported file formats to read and write files.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFileFormats.Automatic
member.summary: Automatically detect the type of the file when opening files. If used when saving, FlexCel will choose whether to use xls or xlsx depending on the file extension (when saving to a file) or the value of when saving to a stream or when the format can't be determined from the extension.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFileFormats.Text
member.summary: Delimiter separated values. Depending on the delimiter, this can be csv, tab delimited text, etc.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFileFormats.Pxl
member.summary: Pocket Excel 1.0 or 2.0

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFileFormats.Xlsx
member.summary: Excel 2007 standard file format. Note that this is *not* a macro enabled file format. If you want to save a file with macros, you need to use Xlsm instead.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFileFormats.Xlsm
member.summary: Excel 2007 macro enabled file format.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TCellType
member.summary: Values we can write on a cell

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TCellType.Number
member.summary: Double precision number.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TCellType.DateTime
member.summary: Not a real type (it is a number).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TCellType.String
member.summary: An unicode string. Might be formatted.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TCellType.Bool
member.summary: Boolean.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TCellType.Error
member.summary: Error code

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TCellType.Empty
member.summary: Blank cell.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TCellType.Formula
member.summary: A formula.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TCellType.Unknown
member.summary: The .NET type does not map to any Excel type. (for example a class)

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcMode
member.summary: Sets how the excel file will be recalculated. Normally FlexCel calculates a file only before saving and when you explicitly call . With this enum you can change that behavior.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcMode.Smart
member.summary: The file will be recalculated before saving, *only* if there are any changes on the file. This mode is the recommended, because it allows you to open and save a file (for example to remove a password) without modifying the formula results. If you modify any value on the sheet, a recalculation will be done to get the new values.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcMode.Forced
member.summary: The file will *always* be recalculated before saving. Use it if you are loading files that might not be recalculated, to make sure they will. If you open a not calculated file on Smart mode and then save it without modifying anything, it will remain not calculated.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcMode.Manual
member.summary: The file will *never* be recalculated by FlexCel (Except if you do a forced recalc: XlsFile.Recalc(true). All formula results will be set to null and formulas will be modified so Excel recalculates them when you open the file. If you are only using Excel to open the generated files the result will be the same as with a recalculated file, but if you try to open it with a viewer you won't see the formula results. You should not need to use manual recalculation. The only case where it might be useful is if you are setting the formula results yourself and don't want FlexCel to change them when it saves.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcMode.OnEveryChange
member.summary: The file will be recalculated each time a value changes on the sheet. Do not use this mode on normal files, as it can be really slow!! This option could be of use for an interactive viewer.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion
member.summary: Identifies how FlexCel will identify itself in the generated file, in order to recalculate.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.AlwaysRecalc
member.summary: If you choose this option, Excel will always recalculate the full file on open, and ask for saving changes when closing the file.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.SameAsInputFile
member.summary: FlexCel will write the same information that was in the original file it opened. Note that if you create a file with XlsFile.NewFile, then the version will be the version you specify in the NewFile parameters. By default, this is Excel 2003.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.LatestKnownExcelVersion
member.summary: This will use the latest Excel version that FlexCel is aware of. Note that when you update FlexCel to a newer version, the recalculating version might change if it adds support for newer Excel versions.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2003
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2003. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2007
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2007. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2010
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2010. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2013
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2013. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2016
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2016. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TSheetCalcMode
member.summary: How the file will be calculated by Excel. This enum doesn't affect FlexCel recalculation.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetCalcMode.Manual
member.summary: Manual recalculation.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSheetCalcMode.Automatic

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode
member.summary: Inserting mode. Important: This enumeration is also used when deleting ranges. When deleting, Down means Up and Right means Left.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.NoneDown
member.summary:
Cells will not be inserted but just overwrite existing ones. If count is >0, additional ranges will be copied down.
When deleting, this mode will clear the cells and not move anything.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.NoneRight
member.summary:
Cells will not be inserted but just overwrite existing ones. If count is >0, additional ranges will be copied right.
When deleting, this mode will clear the cells and not move anything.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.ShiftRowDown
member.summary:
Inserts whole rows. Moves all destination rows down.
When deleting, moves cells up.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.ShiftColRight
member.summary:
Inserts whole columns. Moves all destination columns to the right.
When deleting, moves columns to the right of the deleted columns to the left.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.ShiftRangeDown
member.summary:
Moves all destination cells down. This WON'T move the whole row, only cells on the range.
When deleting, moves cells up.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.ShiftRangeRight
member.summary:
Moves all destination cells to the right. This WON'T move the whole column, only cells on the range.
When deleting, moves cells to the left.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode
member.summary: What we do with the cells when we call InsertAndCopyRange.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.All
member.summary: Will copy all (values, ranges, images, formulas, etc).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.OnlyFormulas
member.summary: Will copy all except values. Useful when you are going to replace those values anyway.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.None
member.summary: Won't copy anything. Only inserts.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.OnlyFormulasAndNoObjects
member.summary: Will copy all except values and objects (like images). Useful when you are going to replace those values anyway.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.AllIncludingDontMoveAndSizeObjects
member.summary: Will copy all objects, including those that are marked as "do not copy" in the file. You will normally not want to use this.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.Formats
member.summary: Will copy cell formatting, but not cell contents. Images and objects will be copied too.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TSortFormulaMode
member.summary: Defines how FlexCel will sort a range of cells, when you call XlsFile.Sort. You will normally want to specify "MoveFormulas", but for huge amounts of data where you know formulas won't matter, you might choose the "ExcelLike" mode. Note that Excel itself doesn't adapt correctly the formulas when sorting, and it works like the ExcelLike mode.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSortFormulaMode.MoveFormulas
member.summary: All formulas will remain pointing to the right places after the sort. This is the correct thing to do, and you will normally want to use this mode, unless it is too slow.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSortFormulaMode.ExcelLike
member.summary: Formulas that are outside the range being sorted won't change. So if you are sorting for example the range A1:B10, and have a formula in A20: = A1, after sorting A20 will still be A1, and not reference the cell it used to reference. Formulas inside the range being sorted that point to different rows will not keep pointing to the same row. If for example in A1 you have =A2 and the sorting moves row 1 to 5, then the formula will be =A6, instead of pointing to the place where row 2 moved. This method is faster than the "MoveFormulas" approach, and it is the method Excel itself uses. If you don't have formulas pointing to other places in the row being moved, this method can be much faster.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TReferenceStyle
member.summary: Use this enumerator in the property to specify the reference mode that FlexCel will use when you enter formulas as text or when it returns the formula text.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TReferenceStyle.A1
member.summary: Standard A1 mode. Uses letters for the columns and numbers for the rows.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TReferenceStyle.R1C1
member.summary: R1C1 style. Uses numbers for both columns and rows.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.IRowColSize.ScreenScaling
member.summary:
This property lets you specify the screen scaling that FlexCel will assume for reading xlsx files in percent. (default is 100 which means 100%). The values can be between 100 and 500.
Column widths in xlsx files which don't have a fixed column width set will be different in different screen resolutions. So we need to know which resolution to emulate in order to read those files correctly. You will probably want to leave this property to the default value of 100, but you can change it if needed.
For more information, please read

Object path to the image when it is a grouped image. For toplevel images you can use String.Empty. In other case, you need to use the value returned by

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType
member.summary: Represents a connection type. This enumeration lists the documented values, but there could be other values peresent in the file.

member.summary: Invalid value. This value shouldn't happen on a file.

member.summary: ODBC-based source.

member.summary: Custom data connection source. This value is application-defined, but in Office it is used for DAO connections.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.CustomApplicationDefined
member.summary: Custom data connection source. This value is application-defined, but in Office it is used for application defined connection files.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.WebQuery
member.summary: A Web Query.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.CustomOLEDB
member.summary: Custom data connection source. This value is application-defined, but in Office it is used for OLEDB connections.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.Text
member.summary: Text-based source.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.CustomADO
member.summary: Custom data connection source. This value is application-defined, but in Office it is used for ADO connections.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.CustomDSP
member.summary: Custom data connection source. This value is application-defined, but in Office it is used for DSP connections.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionReconnectionMethod
member.summary: How to reconnect when a connection fails.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionReconnectionMethod.Unknown
member.summary: Invalid value. This value shouldn't happen on a file.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionReconnectionMethod.AsRequired
member.summary: On refresh use the existing connection information. If the existing information cannot be used to establish a connection, get updated connection information, if available from the external connection file.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionReconnectionMethod.Always
member.summary: On every refresh get updated connection information from the external connection file, if available, and use that instead of the existing connection information. In this case the data refresh will fail if the external connection file is unavailable.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionReconnectionMethod.Never
member.summary: Never get updated connection information from the external connection file even if it is available and even if the existing connection information cannot be used.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionCredentialMethod

member.summary: Integrated authentication.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionCredentialMethod.None
member.summary: Use no credentials at all.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionCredentialMethod.Stored
member.summary: Use stored credentials.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionCredentialMethod.Prompt

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection
member.summary: This class represents one data connection on the workbook.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.DbProperties
member.summary: This element stores all properties associated with an ODBC or OLE DB external data connection.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.OlapProperties
member.summary: This element contains all the properties needed for an OLAP data connection. OLAP connections contain both the and TDataConnectionOlapProperties child elements.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.WebQueryProperties
member.summary: This element specifies the properties for a web query source. A web query will retrieve data from HTML tables, and can also supply HTTP "Get" parameters to be processed by the web server in generating the HTML by including the parameters and parameter elements.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.TextImportProperties
member.summary: This element contains all of the text import settings.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Parameters
member.summary: This element stores properties about any parameters used with external data connections. Parameters are used to change the query executed externally and cause different data to be retrieved into the workbook.The type of parameter used determines whether the user is prompted for a value before data is refreshed, or the value is pulled from a cell in the workbook, or whether the same value should be used until explicitly changed in the data connection. Parameters are permitted for ODBC and web queries.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.ID
member.summary: Specifies The unique identifier of this connection.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.SourceFile
member.summary: Used when the external data source is file-based. When a connection to such a data source fails, the spreadsheet application attempts to connect directly to this file. Can be expressed in URI or system-specific file path notation.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.OdcFile
member.summary: Specifies the full path to external connection file from which this connection was created. If a connection fails during an attempt to refresh data, and ReconnectionMethod is AsRequired, then the spreadsheet application will try again using information from the external connection file instead of the connection object embedded within the workbook.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.KeepAlive
member.summary: True when the spreadsheet application should make efforts to keep the connection open.When false, the application should close the connection after retrieving the information.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Interval
member.summary: Specifies the number of minutes between automatic refreshes of the connection. When this attribute is not present, the connection is not automatically refreshed.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Name
member.summary: Specifies the name of the connection. Each connection shall have a unique name.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Description
member.summary: Specifies the user description for this connection.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.ConnectionType
member.summary: Specifies the data source type.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.ReconnectionMethod
member.summary: Specifies what the spreadsheet application should do when a connection fails.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.RefreshedVersion
member.summary: For backward compatibility purposes, this attribute indicates the version of the spreadsheet application that last refreshed the connection.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.MinRefreshableVersion
member.summary: For compatibility with legacy spreadsheet applications. This represents the minimum version # that is required to be able to correctly refresh the data connection.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.SavePassword
member.summary: True if the password is to be saved as part of the connection string

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.IsNew
member.summary: True if the connection has not been refreshed for the first time. This can happen when the user saves the file before a query has finished returning.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Deleted
member.summary: Indicates whether the associated workbook connection has been deleted. Deleted connections contain only the attributes name and deleted=true, all other information is removed when saving the file. If a new connection is created with the same name as a deleted connection, then the deleted connection is overwritten by the new connection.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.OnlyUseConnectionFile
member.summary:
Indicates whether the spreadsheet application should always and only use the connection information in the external connection file indicated by the odcFile attribute when the connection is refreshed. If false, then the spreadsheet application should follow the procedure indicated by the reconnectionMethod attribute.
Applies to ODBC connections, and may be applied to custom data connections.This attribute is ignored for other types of connections.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.SingleSignOnId
member.summary: Identifier for Single Sign On (SSO) used for authentication between an intermediate spreadsheetML server and the external data source.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Credentials
member.summary: Specifies the authentication method to be used when establishing (or re-establishing) the connection.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.SaveData
member.summary: True if the external data fetched over the connection to populate a table is to be saved with the workbook; otherwise, false. This exists for data security purposes - if no external data is saved in (or "cached") in the workbook, then current user credentials can be required every time to retrieve the relevant data, and people won't see the data the workbook author had last been using before saving the file.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.RefreshOnLoad
member.summary: True if this connection should be refreshed when opening the file.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Background
M:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if obj is the same as this object.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hashcode of the object.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties
member.summary: This element stores all properties associated with an ODBC or OLE DB external data connection.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties.Connection
member.summary: The string used to initiate a session with a data source.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties.Command
member.summary: The string containing the database command to pass to the data provider that will interact with the external source in order to retrieve data.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties.ServerCommand
member.summary: Specifies a second command text string that is persisted when PivotTable server-based page fields are in use. For ODBC connections, serverCommand is usually a broader query than command(no WHERE clause is present in the former). Based on these 2 commands, parameter UI can be populated and parameterized queries can be constructed.

summary.para: Specifies the custom data source command type. Values are passed to the custom data source provider and their meaning might change depending on the provider.

For example, for OLEDB, the values can be: 1. Query specifies a cube name 2. Query specifies a SQL statement 3. Query specifies a table name 4. Query specifies that default information has been given, and it is up to the provider how to interpret. 5. Query is against a web based List Data Provider

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if both objects are the same.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hashcode of the object.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties
member.summary: This element contains all the properties needed for an OLAP data connection. OLAP connections contain both the and TDataConnectionOlapProperties child elements.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.Local
member.summary: Flag indicating whether we should get data from the local cube on refresh versus the original data source. true if a local cube has been created for OLAP data, and it should be used instead of the server.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.LocalConnection
member.summary: Specifies a connection string to use when a local cube is available. This is used when local is set to true.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.LocalRefresh
member.summary: Flag indicating whether we should refresh the local cube from the original data source. When true, the original OLAP data source is queried each time the user explicitly refreshes the data in the application, and a new local cube is constructed from this query.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.SendLocale
member.summary: When true, the spreadsheetML app should send the user interface locale ID to the OLAP provider to retrieve localized member names and properties, etc. When false, no locale ID is expected.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.RowDrillCount
member.summary: Maximum number of drill-through rows to return when the user drills through an aggregate value in a PivotTable.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.ServerFill
member.summary: When true a PivotTable based on an OLAP source should format the data and aggregate cells in the PivotTable view using the background color from the OLAP source if this information is available.When false, OLAP server background fill colors are ignored, and standard formatting rules within the worksheet are followed.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.ServerNumberFormat
member.summary: When true, a PivotTable based on OLAP source should format the data and aggregate cells in the PivotTable view using the number format from the OLAP source.When false, OLAP server number formats are ignored, and standard formatting rules within the worksheet are followed.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.ServerFont
member.summary: When true, a PivotTable based on OLAP source should format the data and aggregate cells in the PivotTable view using the font from the OLAP source (e.g., Arial or Tahoma). When false, OLAP server fonts are ignored, and standard formatting rules within the worksheet are followed.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.ServerFontColor
member.summary: When true a PivotTable based on OLAP source should format the data and aggregate cells in the PivotTable view using the font color from the OLAP source.When false, OLAP server font colors are ignored, and standard formatting rules within the worksheet are followed.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if both objects are the same.

member.summary: Returns the hashcode of the object.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.EditPage
member.summary: The URL of the user-facing web page showing the web query data. This URL is persisted in the case that sourceData = "true" and url has been redirected to reference an XML file. Then the user-facing page can be shown in the UI, and the XML data can be retrieved behind the scenes.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.HtmlFormat
member.summary: How to handle formatting from the HTML source when bringing web query data into the worksheet. Relevant when SourceData is True.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.HtmlTables
member.summary: Flag indicating whether web queries should only work on HTML tables.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.Post
member.summary: Returns or sets the string used with the post method of inputting data into a web server to return data from a web query.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.Url
member.summary: URL to use to refresh external data.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.Xl2000
member.summary: This flag exists for backward compatibility with older existing spreadsheet files, and is set to true if this web query was refreshed in a spreadsheet application newer than or equal to Microsoft Excel 2000. This is an optional attribute that can be ignored.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.TextDates
member.summary: Flag indicating whether dates should be imported into cells in the worksheet as text rather than dates.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.Xl97
member.summary: This flag exists for backward compatibility with older existing spreadhseet files, and is set to true if this web query was created in Microsoft Excel 97. This is an optional attribute that can be ignored.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.FirstRow
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to parse all tables inside a PRE block with the same width settings as the first row.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.ConsecutiveDelimiters
member.summary: Flag indicating whether consecutive delimiters should be treated as just one delimiter.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.ParsePre
member.summary: Flag indicating whether data contained within HTML <PRE> tags in the web page is parsed into columns when you import the page into a query table.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.SourceData
member.summary: Flag indicating that XML source data should be imported instead of the HTML table itself.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.Xml
member.summary: true if the web query source is XML (versus HTML).

member.summary: A collection of tables in the HTML file. This property is never null, and by modifying it you modify the parent WebQueryProperties too.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties
member.summary: This element contains all of the text import settings.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.TextFields
member.summary: Field definitions. This property is never null, and by modifying it you modify the parent TextImportProperties too.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.PromptForFileName
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the user wants to be prompted for the file name on refresh. If false, then the user is not prompted.If true or not present, then the user is prompted.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.FileType
member.summary: Ignorable attribute. Determines the kind of character set to use during import. Only one of FileType and CharacterSet or CodePage shall be specified.

summary.para: Name of the character set associated with the text file. Values for this attribute are restricted to the names and aliases listed in the IANA CHARACTER SETS listing found at http://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets.
If this attribute is not present then the CodePage attribute is used.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.FirstRow
member.summary: Indicates at what row of the file to start the data import. All unsignedInt values are permitted, although it's possible that firstRow is higher than the number of rows in the text file, in which case no data is imported.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.SourceFile
member.summary: Path to the text file to use to import external data. Can be expressed in URI or systemspecific file path notation.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.IsDelimited
member.summary: True if the file is Tab or character delimited. false if the file should be parsed according to fixed length fields.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.DecimalSeparator
member.summary: The decimal separator character. This and the thousands attribute are used only when data in the text file contains decimal and thousands separators that are different from those used on the computer, due to a different language setting being used.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.ThousandsSeparator
member.summary: The thousands separator character. This and the decimal attribute are used only when data in the text file contains decimal and thousands separators that are different from those used on the computer, due to a different language setting being used.Please refer to the decimal attribute description above for a Table describing the behavior. Strings values of this attribute are expected to be one character in length.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.TabIsDelimiter
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to treat tab characters as field delimiters. If false, then tabs will not be used as delimiters.If true or not present, then they are used as delimiters.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.SpaceIsDelimiter
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to treat space characters as field delimiters.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.CommaIsDelimiter
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to treat comma characters as field delimiters.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.SemicolonIsDelimiter
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to treat semicolon characters as field delimiters.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.ConsecutiveDelimiters
member.summary: Flag indicating whether consecutive delimiters should be treated as just one delimiter. If this flag is true than it's possible or even likely that some rows will return more fields than others, and these fields will always fill cells in the worksheet from left to right.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.Qualifier
member.summary: Character used as the text string qualifier.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.Delimiter
member.summary: User-specified character to be treated as a field delimiter. Only single characters are supported.

member.summary: Returns true if both objects are the same.

member.summary: Returns the hashcode of the object.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter
member.summary: This element stores properties about any parameters used with external data connections. Parameters are used to change the query executed externally and cause different data to be retrieved into the workbook.The type of parameter used determines whether the user is prompted for a value before data is refreshed, or the value is pulled from a cell in the workbook, or whether the same value should be used until explicitly changed in the data connection. Parameters are permitted for ODBC and web queries.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.Name
member.summary: The name of the parameter.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.SqlType
member.summary: SQL data type of the parameter. This attribute is only supported for ODBC data sources. For more information, including supported data types, see ISO 9075-3:2008, Table 33 - Codes used for concise data types.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.ParameterType
member.summary: Type of parameter used. If the parameterType=value, then the value from , , , or are used.In this case, it is expected that only one of those properties is specified.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.RefreshOnChange
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the query should automatically refresh when the contents of a cell that provides the parameter value changes. If true, then external data is refreshed using the new parameter value every time there's a change. If false, then external data is only refreshed when requested by the user, or some other event triggers refresh (e.g., workbook opened).

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.Prompt
member.summary: Prompt string for the parameter. Presented to the spreadsheet user along with input UI to collect the parameter value before refreshing the external data.Used only when = prompt.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.AsBoolean
member.summary: Boolean value to use as the query parameter. Used only when = value.

member.summary: Template. (Standard property)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId.LastSavedBy
member.summary: Last user to save the file. (Standard property). Note: Unless you set this property explicitly with XlsFile.DocumentProperties.SetStandardProperty, FlexCel will save the creator instead. This is because you don't normally want to save the last user who modified a template.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId.RevisionNumber
member.summary: Revision number. (Standard property). Note:While this is a string and Windows Explorer will allow you to set any value here, Excel will report any file with a revision which is not an integer as invalid.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId.TotalEditingTime
member.summary: Total editing time. (Standard property)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId.LastPrinted
member.summary: Last printed date. (Standard property)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId.CreateTimeDate
member.summary: Date of created in UTC time. (Standard property). Note: Unless you set this property explicitly, FlexCel will save the current time as the creation date. If you are creating a new file this is what you want. But if you are modifying and existing file and want to preserve the original creation date, you need to explicitly set ths property.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId.ScaleCrop

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId.HeadingPairs
member.summary: Internally used property indicating the grouping of different document parts and the number of items in each group. The titles of the document parts are stored in the TitlesofParts property. The HeadingPairs property is stored as a vector of variants, in repeating pairs of VT_LPSTR (or VT_LPWSTR) and VT_I4 values. The VT_LPSTR value represents a heading name, and the VT_I4 value indicates the count of document parts under that heading. (Extended property)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId.TitlesofParts
member.summary: Names of document parts. (Extended property)

member.summary: Manager of the project. (Extended property)

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId.Company
member.summary: Company name. (Extended property)

member.summary: Boolean value to indicate whether the custom links are hampered by excessive noise, for all applications. (Extended property)

member.summary: Estimate of the number of characters in the document including whitespace.

member.summary: True if the links were changed outside the application and must be updated.

member.summary: Version of the application that wrote the file. The 2 high order bytes are the major version, and the 2 lower bytes the minor version.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties
member.summary: Properties for an Excel sheet.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.GetStandardProperty(FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId)
member.summary:
Returns a standard document property (Like Author, Title, etc.). This method returns an object that might be:
null: If the property is not assigned.
Int16, Int32, Int64, Single, Double, Decimal: If the property is a number.
DateTime: If the property is a Date or a DateTime.
String: If the property is a string.
Boolean: If the property is a boolean.
An array of byte (byte[]): If the property is a Blob.
An array of object (object[]): If the property is an array. Each one of the members of the array must be of one of the types specified here.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.GetUsedStandardProperties(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a list of all the standard properties that are set.
member.param: If true, only the properties that you can set will be returned.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.SetStandardProperty(FlexCel.Core.TPropertyId,System.String)
member.summary: This method only works in xlsx files. It will set the standard property with the given Id to the specified value. Set the value to null or empty to clear the property.
member.param: Property id that we want to modify.
Set it to null or empty to clear the property.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.GetCustomProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a custom property with a given name.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.SetCustomProperty(System.String,FlexCel.Core.TDocumentCustomPropertyType,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a custom property with a given name. Set the value to null or empty string to remove the property.
member.param: Name of the custom property you want to create or modify.
Type of the property (boolean, string, etc.)
Value for the property. Note that while it is a string, it must be convertible to the type you are specifying. Doubles should use "." as decimal separators.
Numeric Id for the property. This value must be unique and bigger or equal to 2.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.GetAllCustomProperties
member.summary: Returns a list of all the names of custom properties in the file.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.RemoveAllProperties
member.summary: This method will remove all document properties of the file. You can use it to be sure you aren't embedding any confidential information on the properties.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.PreserveCreationDate
member.summary: By default FlexCel will set the creation date in the file to be the date when you actually created it, no matter the value originally stored in the file. This assumes you are starting from a template and generating a new document from it. But if you are modifying an existing file and want to preserve the original creation date, then you need to set this property to true. Note that this property sets itself automatically to true if you manually set the creation time of a file.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.PreserveModifiedDate
member.summary: By default FlexCel will set the modified date in the file to be the date when you actually saved it, no matter the value originally stored in the file. But if you need to set a different modified date than the date in the server, or you don't want a new modified date to be saved and preserve the one in the document, then you need to set this property to true. If you are setting this property to true, you probably also want to set to true. Note that this property sets itself automatically to true if you manually set the modified time of a file.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentCustomPropertyType.Unknown
member.summary: The property is something else. Note that Excel won't recognize properties with other data types than the ones in this enumeration, but you can write any variant as a custom property. When the type is unknown, the real type is stored in the PropTypeStr field.

member.summary: GUID for the property. In Excel this value is always {D5CDD505-2E9C-101B-9397-08002B2CF9AE} You can leave this null, in this case {D5CDD505-2E9C-101B-9397-08002B2CF9AE} will be used.

member.summary: Numeric Id for the property. This value is for OLE compatibility and must be unique.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDocumentCustomProperty.LinkTarget
member.summary: Specifies the name of a bookmark in the table or named cell from which the value of this custom document property should be extracted. You can normally leave this value null.

member.summary: Type of the property. Note that while you can define any variant, Excel only recognizes the types in this enumeration.

member.summary: Value of the property. You must ensure it is valid for the proptype.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.None

member.summary: Specifies a Dark shadow color for three-dimensional display elements.

member.summary: Specifies a Light color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.ActiveBorder
member.summary: Specifies an Active Window Border Color.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.ActiveCaption
member.summary: Specifies the active window title bar color. In particular the left side color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar if the gradient effect is enabled.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.AppWorkspace
member.summary: Specifies the Background color of multiple document interface (MDI) applications.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.Background
member.summary: Specifies the desktop background color.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.BtnFace
member.summary: Specifies the face color for three-dimensional display elements and for dialog box backgrounds.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.BtnHighlight
member.summary: Specifies the highlight color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.BtnShadow
member.summary: Specifies the shadow color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing away from the light source).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.BtnText
member.summary: Specifies the color of text on push buttons.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.CaptionText
member.summary: Specifies the color of text in the caption, size box, and scroll bar arrow box.

member.summary: Specifies the right side color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.GradientInactiveCaption
member.summary: Specifies the right side color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.GrayText
member.summary: Specifies a grayed (disabled) text. This color is set to 0 if the current display driver does not support a solid gray color.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.Highlight
member.summary: Specifies the color of Item(s) selected in a control.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.HighlightText
member.summary: Specifies the text color of item(s) selected in a control.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.HotLight
member.summary: Specifies the color for a hyperlink or hot-tracked item.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.InactiveBorder
member.summary: Specifies the color of the Inactive window border.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.InactiveCaption
member.summary: Specifies the color of the Inactive window caption. Specifies the left side color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar if the gradient effect is enabled.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TSystemColor.InactiveCaptionText
member.summary: Specifies the color of text in an inactive caption.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor
member.summary: Represents a Color for a drawing or a theme. Different from TExcelColor, this structure is defined in terms of DrawingML, not SpreadsheetML.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.ColorType
member.summary: Identifies which kind of color is the one to apply in this structure.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.HSL
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has an HSL color, as a 0xHHSSLL integer.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.RGB
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has an RGB color, as a 0xRRGGBB integer.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.ScRGB
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has an scRGB color.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.Preset
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has a Preset color.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.System
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has a System color.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.Theme
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has a Themed color.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType
member.summary: List of transformations that can be done to a color.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Tint
member.summary: Yields a lighter version of its input color. A 10% tint is 10% of the input color combined with 90% white.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Shade
member.summary: Yields a darker version of its input color. A 10% shade is 10% of the input color combined with 90% black.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Complement
member.summary: Yields the complement of its input color. For example, the complement of red is green.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Inverse
member.summary: Yields the inverse of its input color. For example, the inverse of red (1,0,0) is cyan (0,1,1).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Gray
member.summary: Yields a grayscale of its input color, taking into relative intensities of the red, green, and blue primaries.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Alpha
member.summary: Yields its input color with the specified opacity, but with its color unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.AlphaOff
member.summary: Yields a more or less opaque version of its input color. An alpha offset never increases the alpha beyond 100% or decreases below 0%; i.e., the result of the transform pins the alpha to the range of [0%,100%]. A 10% alpha offset increases a 50% opacity to 60%. A -10% alpha offset decreases a 50% opacity to 40%.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.AlphaMod
member.summary: Yields a more or less opaque version of its input color. An alpha modulate never increases the alpha beyond 100%. A 200% alpha modulate makes a input color twice as opaque as before. A 50% alpha modulate makes a input color half as opaque as before.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Hue
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified hue, but with its saturation and luminance unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.HueOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its hue shifted, but with its saturation and luminance unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.HueMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its hue modulated by the given percentage.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Sat
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified saturation, but with its hue and luminance unchanged. Typically saturation values fall in the range [0%, 100%].

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.SatOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its saturation shifted, but with its hue and luminance unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.SatMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its saturation modulated by the given percentage. A 50% saturation modulate reduces the saturation by half. A 200% saturation modulate doubles the saturation.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Lum
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified luminance, but with its hue and saturation unchanged. Typically, luminance values fall in the range [0%,100%].

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.LumOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its luminance shifted, but with its hue and saturation unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.LumMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its luminance modulated by the given percentage. A 50% luminance modulate reduces the luminance by half. A 200% luminance modulate doubles the luminance.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Red
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified red component, but with its green and blue components unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.RedOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its red component shifted, but with its green and blue components unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.RedMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its red component modulated by the given percentage. A 50% red modulate reduces the red component by half. A 200% red modulate doubles the red component.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Green
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified green component, but with its red and blue components unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.GreenOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its green component shifted, but with its red and blue components unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.GreenMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its green component modulated by the given percentage. A 50% green modulate reduces the green component by half. A 200% green modulate doubles the green component.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Blue
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified blue component, but with its red and green components unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.BlueOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its blue component shifted, but with its red and green components unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.BlueMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its blue component modulated by the given percentage. A 50% blue modulate reduces the blue component by half. A 200% blue modulate doubles the blue component.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Gamma
member.summary: Yields the sRGB gamma shift of its input color.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.InvGamma
member.summary: Yields the inverse sRGB gamma shift of its input color.
