member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment types for text in a drawing.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.Left
member.summary: Align text to the left margin.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.Center
member.summary: Align text in the center.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.Right
member.summary: Align text to the right margin.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.Justified
member.summary: Align text so that it is justified across the whole line. It is smart in the sense that it does not justify sentences which are short.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.JustLow
member.summary: Aligns the text with an adjusted kashida length for Arabic text.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.Distributed
member.summary: Distributes the text words across an entire text line.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.ThaiDist
member.summary: Distributes Thai text specially, because each character is treated as a word.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign
member.summary: Different types of font alignment.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign.Automatic
member.summary: When the text flow is horizontal or simple vertical same as fontBaseline but for other vertical modes same as fontCenter.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign.Top
member.summary: The letters are anchored to the top baseline of a single line.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign.Center
member.summary: The letters are anchored between the two baselines of a single line.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign.BaseLine
member.summary: The letters are anchored to the bottom baseline of a single line.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign.Bottom
member.summary: The letters are anchored to the very bottom of a single line. This is different than the bottom baseline because of letters such as "g," "q," "y," etc.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle
member.summary: Possible underline types in a drawing.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.None
member.summary: No underline.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Words
member.summary: Underline just the words and not the spaces between them.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Single
member.summary: Underline the text with a single line of normal thickness.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Double
member.summary: Underline the text with two lines of normal thickness.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Heavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, thick line.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Dotted
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, dotted line of normal thickness.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DottedHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, thick dotted line.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Dash
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, dashed line of normal thickness.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DashHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, thick dashed line.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DashLong
member.summary: Underline the text with a single line of normal thickness consisting of long dashes.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DashLongHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single thick line consisting of long dashes.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DotDash
member.summary: Underline the text with a single line consisting of alternating dots and dashes of normal thcikness.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DotDashHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single thick line consisting of alternating dots and dashes.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DotDotDash
member.summary: Underline the text with a single line of normal thickness consisting of repeating two dots and dashes.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DotDotDashHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single thick line consisting of repeating two dots and dashes.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Wavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single wavy line of normal thickness.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.WavyHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, thick wavy line.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.WavyDouble
member.summary: Underline the text with two wavy lines of normal thickness.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextStrike
member.summary: How the text is stroke out.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextStrike.None
member.summary: No strike is applied to the text.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextStrike.Single
member.summary: A single strike is applied to the text.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextStrike.Double
member.summary: A double strike is applied to the text.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextCapitalization
member.summary: how text is capitalized when rendered.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextCapitalization.None
member.summary: No capitalization.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextCapitalization.Small
member.summary: Apply small caps to the text. All letters are converted to lower case.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextCapitalization.All
member.summary: Apply all caps on the text. All lower case letters are converted to upper case even though they are stored differently in the backing store.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.MarL
member.summary: Specifies the left margin of the paragraph.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.MarR
member.summary: Specifies the right margin of the paragraph.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.Lvl
member.summary: Specifies the particular level text properties that this paragraph follows.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.Indent
member.summary: Specifies the indent size that is applied to the first line of text in the paragraph. An indentation of 0 is considered to be at the same location as marL attribute.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.Algn
member.summary: Specifies the alignment that is to be applied to the paragraph.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.DefTabSz
member.summary: Specifies the default size for a tab character within this paragraph. This attribute should be used to describe the spacing of tabs within the paragraph instead of a leading indentation tab. For indentation tabs there are the marL and indent attributes to assist with this.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.Rtl
member.summary: Specifies whether the text is right-to-left or left-to-right in its flow direction.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.EaLnBrk
member.summary: Specifies whether an East Asian word can be broken in half and wrapped onto the next line without a hyphen being added.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.FontAlgn
member.summary: Determines where vertically on a line of text the actual words are positioned. This deals with vertical placement of the characters with respect to the baselines.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.LatinLnBrk
member.summary: Specifies whether a Latin word can be broken in half and wrapped onto the next line without a hyphen being added.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.HangingPunct
member.summary: Specifies whether punctuation is to be forcefully laid out on a line of text or put on a different line of text.

member.summary: Returns the text attributes with the default values.
Creates a new instance.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.Fill
member.summary: Fill style for the text.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.Line
member.summary: Line style for the text.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.Effects
member.summary: Effects applied to the text.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.Highlight
member.summary: Highlight color that is present for a run of text.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.Underline
member.summary: Underline fill for the text.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.Latin
member.summary: This element specifies that a Latin font be used for a specific run of text. This font is specified with a typeface attribute much like the others but is specifically classified as a Latin font.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.EastAsian
member.summary: This element specifies that an East Asian font be used for a specific run of text. This font is specified with a typeface attribute much like the others but is specifically classified as an East Asian font.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.ComplexScript
member.summary: This element specifies that a complex script font be used for a specific run of text. This font is specified with a typeface attribute much like the others but is specifically classified as a complex script font.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.Symbol
member.summary: This element specifies that a symbol script font be used for a specific run of text. This font is specified with a typeface attribute much like the others but is specifically classified as a symbol script font.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.HyperlinkClick
member.summary: Specifies the on-click hyperlink information to be applied to a run of text. When the hyperlink text is clicked the link is fetched.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.HyperlinkMouseOver
member.summary: Specifies the mouse-over hyperlink information to be applied to a run of text. When the mouse is hovered over this hyperlink text the link is fetched.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.RightToLeft
member.summary: This element specifies whether the contents of this run shall have right-to-left characteristics.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.Attributes
member.summary: Group of simple attributes applied to the text run.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes
member.summary: Group of simple attributes for text properties.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Empty
member.summary: Returns the text attributes with the default values.
Creates a new instance.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Kumimoji
member.summary: Specifies whether the numbers contained within vertical text continue vertically with the text or whether they are to be displayed horizontally while the surrounding characters continue in a vertical fashion.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Lang
member.summary: Specifies the language to be used when the generating application is displaying the user interface controls.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.AltLang
member.summary: Specifies the alternate language to use when the generating application is displaying the user interface controls.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size of text within a text run. Whole points are specified in increments of 100 starting with 100 being a point size of 1. For instance a font point size of 12 would be 1200 and a font point size of 12.5 would be 1250.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Bold
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text is formatted as bold text.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Italic
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text is formatted as italic text.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Underline
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text is formatted as underlined text.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Strike
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text is formatted as strikethrough text.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Kern
member.summary: Specifies the minimum font size at which character kerning occurs for this text run. Whole points are specified in increments of 100 starting with 100 being a point size of 1. For instance a font point size of 12 would be 1200 and a font point size of 12.5 would be 1250.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Capitalization
member.summary: Specifies the capitalization that is to be applied to the text run. This is a render-only modification and does not affect the actual characters stored in the text run. This attribute is also distinct from the toggle function where the actual characters stored in the text run are changed.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Spacing
member.summary: Specifies the spacing between characters within a text run. This spacing is specified numerically and should be consistently applied across the entire run of text by the generating application. Whole points are specified in increments of 100 starting with 100 being a point size of 1. For instance a font point size of 12 would be 1200 and a font point size of 12.5 would be 1250.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.NormalizeH
member.summary: Specifies the normalization of height that is to be applied to the text run. This is a render- only modification and does not affect the actual characters stored in the text run. This attribute is also distinct from the toggle function where the actual characters stored in the text run are changed.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Baseline
member.summary: Specifies the baseline for both the superscript and subscript fonts.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.NoProof
member.summary: Specifies that a run of text has been selected by the user to not be checked for mistakes.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Dirty
member.summary: Specifies that the content of a text run has changed since the proofing tools have last been run.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Err
member.summary: Specifies that when this run of text was checked for spelling, grammar, etc. that a mistake was indeed found.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.SmartTagClean
member.summary: Specifies whether or not a text run has been checked for smart tags.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.SmartTagId
member.summary: Specifies a smart tag identifier for a run of text. This ID is unique throughout the presentation and is used to reference corresponding auxiliary information about the smart tag.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.BookmarkLinkTarget
member.summary: Specifies the link target name that is used to reference to the proper link properties in a custom XML part within the document.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink
member.summary: Specifies an hyperlink in a drawing. While this class is similar to THyperlink for links in cells, it has some differences.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new hyperlink for a drawing.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new hyperlink for a drawing.
member.param: Url for the link (including the prefix like "file:///")
If blank then a new window will be used.
Tooltip to show when the user hovers over the hyperlink.
Specifies an action that is to be taken when this hyperlink is activated. This can be used to specify a slide to be navigated to or a script of code to be run. Doesn't seem to be used in Excel.
When set to true, the link will be painted in a "Visited" color.
If true, the link will be added to the history.
If true, any sound currently playing will be stopped when you click the link.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.ImageUtils.GetJPEGOrientation(System.Byte[])
member.summary: This function returns the orientation specific to a JPEG file. FlexCel will automatically rotate the images you add with AddImage (same as Excel does), but it will not rotate the images you enter in the headers/footers or if you replace an existing image. In those cases, you can use this method to know if the image needs to be rotated before entering it.
member.param: Image data.
member.returns: Orientation of the JPEG file.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TJpegOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the rotation of a JPEG image.

member.summary: Image is rotated 180 degrees. Corresponds to JPEG orientation 3.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TJpegOrientation.FlipHorizontalAndRotate270CW
member.summary: Image is rotated 270 degrees clockwise and then mirrored horizontally. Corresponds to JPEG orientation 5.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TJpegOrientation.Rotate270CW
member.summary: Image is rotated 270 degrees clockwise. Corresponds to JPEG orientation 6.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TExcelColor
member.summary: Represents an Excel color. Colors in Excel can be defined in four ways: Automatic Colors, Indexed Colors (for compatibility with Excel 2003 or older), Palette colors, and RGB colors. This Structure is immutable, once you create it you cannot change its members. You need to create a new struct to modify it.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.ColorType
member.summary: Identifies which kind of color is the one to apply in this structure.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.RGB
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has an RGB color, as a 0xRRGGBB integer. This property is fully functional with Excel 2007 or newer, older versions will be converted to Indexed color before saving as xls.
Note: When reading a color, the value here might not be the final one, since is applied to get the final color. Use method to find out the RGB color stored in this struct.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.AutomaticFillType
member.summary: Returns the type of automatic color, if this structure contains an automatic color.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.Index
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure contains an indexed color (1 based). This property is for compatibility with xls files (Excel 2003 or older), but if you are not changing the color palette, even for older files, it is preferred to use or instead.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.Theme
member.summary:
Returns the color if it is one of the entries in the theme palette (1 based).
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.Tint
member.summary:
Returns the tint value applied to the color.
If tint is supplied, then it is applied to the RGB value of the color to determine the final color applied.
The tint value is stored as a double from -1.0 .. 1.0, where -1.0 means 100% darken and 1.0 means 100% lighten. Also, 0.0 means no change.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns -1 if obj is more than color, 0 if both colors are the same, and 1 if obj is less than color.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics
member.summary: Returns Information to convert between standard units and Excel units.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.GetFont0Width(FlexCel.Core.IRowColSize)
member.summary: Returns the width of the 0 font on Excel. Normally this is 7, but can change depending on the file. The user might modify it by changing Format->Style->Normal.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.GetFont0Width(FlexCel.Core.IRowColSize,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the width of the 0 font on Excel, taking in account the screen dpi, which you set in XlsFile.ScreenScaling. Note that with a scaling more than 100%, the fontsize returned will be proportionally larger. So a font that returns 10 points at 100% will return 20 points at 200%. While it makes no sense (a point is 1/72 of an inch no matter the resolution) this is the way Excel handles it.
member.param: File with the font.

If true, we will return the font size at the given screen scaling. If false, we will return the font size at 100% (96 dpi). Note that if a font is say 7 points at 100%, it will be 14 points at 200%. We need it this way because it is the way Excel uses it.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.GetFont0SpaceWidth(FlexCel.Core.IRowColSize)
member.summary: Returns the width of a space (" ") in the main font of the workbook.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.FmlaMult(FlexCel.Core.IRowColSize)
member.summary: When showing/printing the sheet and "Show formula" check box is on, column widths are double of the normal ones. This method returns 0.5 when "Show formulas" is turned on, and 1 if it is not.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType
member.summary: Enumerates the different kind of tokens you can find in a formula

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.CellAddress
member.summary: A single cell address in the same sheet or to other sheet. See also CellRange for other tokens that can contain addresses.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.RelativeCellAddress
member.summary: A cell address relative to the cell where the formula is. This token is used mostly in names.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.CellRange
member.summary: A range of cells. See CellAddress for single cell references.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.RelativeCellRange
member.summary: A cell range relative to the cell where the formula is. This token is used mostly in names.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.FunctionToken
member.summary: A function like "Sum" or "If"

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.OperatorToken
member.summary: An operator like "+" or "-"

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.RangeOp
member.summary: Operator in ranges, like "Union" or "Intersection"

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.Whitespace
member.summary: Whitespace like " "

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.Parenthesis
member.summary: A parenthesis surrounding the last token. Note that this token is not used in the formula (since RPN doesn't need parenthesis) but it is there so Excel can display them.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.Name
member.summary: A named range

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.Data
member.summary: Constant data, like "Hello" and 1 in the formula: "=IF(A1 = 1,,"Hello")"

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.DataArray
member.summary: An array of constant data.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.MissingArgument
member.summary: A missing argument for a function. For example the second parameter in the formula: "=IF(A1 = 1,,"Hello")"

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.ReferenceError
member.summary: A token representing a reference to a cell or range that doesn't exist.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.StructuredReference
member.summary: A reference to a Table.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenType.Unsupported
member.summary: This token is not supported by FlexCel.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespaceCharacter
member.summary: Character used in the whitespace.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespaceCharacter.Space
member.summary: Whitespace consists of character 32 (space).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespaceCharacter.LineFeed
member.summary: Whitespace consists of character 10 (line feed).

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespacePosition
member.summary: Specifies where the whitespace is added in relation to the next token.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespacePosition.BeforeToken
member.summary: This is the normal case. Whitespace is added before the next token. The only case where this option is not used is in the case of parentheses.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespacePosition.BeforeOpenParenthesis
member.summary: A parenthesis token covers 2 different parentheses: the open and close ones. So for parentheses, we need 2 different cases for whitespace. BeforeOpenParenthesis is for the spaces before the opening parenthesis. You would use it for example in the formula '= ("hello")'

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespacePosition.BeforeClosingParenthesis
member.summary: A parenthesis token covers 2 different parentheses: the open and close ones. So for parentheses, we need 2 different cases for whitespace. BeforeClosingParenthesis is for the spaces before the closing parenthesis. You would use it for example in the formula '=("hello" )'

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelConfig
member.summary: A central point of for configuring FlexCel parameters.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelConfig.DpiForImages
member.summary: Allows you to change the dpi for vector images (metafiles) when they are rasterized for converting to pdf / HTML / etc. Note that this is a static setting and will affect all files. This setting is the same as TExcelFile.DpiForImages

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelConfig.DpiForReadingImages
member.summary: Allows you to set a DPI for all images FlexCel is importing. If this value is 0 (the default), then FlexCel will try to read the image resolution from the files themselves, if the files have a resolution saved. If there is no resolution saved with the image, FlexCel will assume the images have the screen resolution. When you set this property to a non 0 value (like 96 for example), then FlexCel will assume this is the resolution of the images it is reading, ignoring any resolution stored in the file.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelConfig.XlsxCompressionLevel
member.summary: Zip compression level when creating xlsx files. This setting is the same as TExcelFile.XlsxCompressionLevel. Xlsx files are zip files, and you can compress more or less by trading speed for file size. The faster you can create the file, the bigger the xlsx files created will be. Excel by default uses "Fastest" compression level and we use "Default". Normally using compression levels more than default is not worth it, since the files will take a lot longer to be created, and the size reduction will be very small.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelConfig.PdfPngCompressionLevel
member.summary: Zip compression level when creating pdf files or re encoding png images. Pds and Png files are zip files, and you can compress more or less by trading speed for file size. The faster you can create the file, the bigger the pdf and png files created will be. Normally using compression levels more than default is not worth it, since the files will take a lot longer to be created, and the size reduction will be very small.

This is a "pseudo xml" that is used to write the object texts. No entities more than the ones allowed in xml are used, breaks are

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TImageNaming
member.summary: Defines how images will be automatically named by FlexCel, when you do not supply a better name.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TImageNaming.Default
member.summary: The image will be named using standard naming, in a format similar to "filename_image_n.png"

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TImageNaming.Guid
member.summary: The image will be named using a GUID. This ensures that any image will be unique even if you have many users requesting the same file at the same time. (Default naming will use the same name for all the users, so images would be overwritten). As a downside, everytime an image is called a new file will be created, so you can get a lot of images just from an user refreshing a page.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.THtmlFixes
member.summary: Defines special fixes to the generated files to workaround browser bugs.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.THtmlFixes.IE6TransparentPngSupport
member.summary: By default, Internet explorer does not support transparent PNGs. Normally this is not an issue, since Excel does not use much transparency. But if you rely on transparent images and don't want to use gif images instead of png, you can set this property to true. It will add special code to the HTML file to support transparent images in IE6.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.THtmlFixes.Outlook2007CssSupport
member.summary: Outlook 2007 renders HTML worse than previous versions, since it switched to the Word 2007 rendering engine instead of Internet Explorer to show HTML emails. If you apply this fix, some code will be added to the generated HTML file to improve the display in Outlook 2007. Other browsers will not be affected and will still render the original file. Turn this option on if you plan to email the generated file as an HTML email or to edit them in Word 2007. Note that the pages will not validate with the w3c validator if this option is on.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.THtmlFixes.WordWrapSupport
member.summary: Some older browsers (and Word 2007) might not support the CSS white-space tag. In this case, if a line longer than a cell cannot be expanded to the right (because there is data in the next cell) it will wrap down instead of being cropped. This fix will cut the text on this cell to the displayable characters. If a letter was displayed by the half on the right, after applying this fix it will not display. This fix is automatically applied when is selected, so there is normally no reason to apply it. You might get a smaller file with this fix (if you have a lot of hidden text), but the display will not be as accurate as when it is off, so it is recommended to keep it off.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.THtmlFixes.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: True if both objects are equal.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError
member.summary: An enumeration of all possible FlexCel non fatal errors that can be logged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.Undefined
member.summary: This error should never happen.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.XlsTooManyPageBreaks
member.summary: There are more page breaks in this page than the maximum allowed, and page breaks over this maximum are being ignored. You can control if you want a "real" exception here with the and properties.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.XlsxInvalidName
member.summary: A corrupt xlsx file can have invalid names. If is set to the correct value, those names will be imported as #REF! instead of rising an Exception.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.XlsxMissingPart
member.summary: The file has references to other parts that don't exist. For example, an image might be referenced in a sheet, but the actual image data missing from the file. If is set to the correct value, those parts will be ignored.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.RenderMetafile
member.summary: There was a GDI+ error trying to draw or print a metafile. It will be rendered as a bitmap.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.RenderCorruptImage
member.summary: The image could not be rendered by GDI+.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.RenderErrorDrawingImage
member.summary: An image could not be drawn. This error normally happens in .NET 1.1 if vj# is not installed.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.RenderGenericPreview
member.summary: A generic error when drawing the preview.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.PdfFontNotFound
member.summary:
The font was not found in the system. A substitute font will be used for the rendering, and it might not look the same.
If you are seeing this message in a server, make sure the server has the same fonts installed as the machine where you developed the application.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.PdfGlyphNotInFont
member.summary:
FlexCel is trying to render a character that is not in the font or the fallback fonts. This character will show as an empty square in the generated PDF file.
Normally this means that Excel is replacing fonts, for example Arial with MS Mincho, and to fix this error you should provide a suitable list of Fallback fonts. Look at the PDF documentation in Exporting to PDF for more information ("Dealing with missing fonts and Glyphs" section).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.PdfUsedFallbackFont
member.summary:
FlexCel is trying to render a character that is not in the font, but it is in the fallback font list. This character will be drawn with the fallback font.
Normally this means that Excel is replacing fonts, for example Arial with MS Mincho. Look at the PDF documentation in Exporting to PDF for more information ("Dealing with missing fonts and Glyphs" section).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.PdfFauxBoldOrItalics
member.summary: The font you are trying to use does not have a "bold" or "italic" variation, and we will use "faux" font created by making the normal font heavier or slanting it to the right. This normally results in lower quality fonts, and will not work with fonts embedded. We recommend that you use fonts that have italics and bold variations. Look at the PDF documentation in Exporting to PDF for more information ("Dealing with missing fonts and Glyphs" section).

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.PdfCorruptFontInFontFolder
member.summary: The "Fonts" folder in this machine has a file that could not be parsed by FlexCel and is probably corrupt. While this will not affect FlexCel in any way, you might want to look at the "Font" folder and remove this font, since it can make windows slower.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.PdfFontLicenseDoesntAllowEmbedding
member.summary: Trying to embed a font which is not licensed to be embedded.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.HtmlSaveSharingViolation
member.summary: There was a sharing violation when trying to save an html file, and is true. Normally this just means two parallel threads trying to write the same file and can be safely ignored.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.MalformedUrl
member.summary: A malformed Url was detected in the xls file and was not exported. An example of this might be: "mailto:test@test@test".

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.RecoveryInvalidName
member.summary: A name couldn't be loaded.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.RecoveryInvalidFormulaTokens

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlexCelError.RecoveryInvalidFormat

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TFontScheme
member.summary: Specifies the scheme to which a font belongs in the theme. This attribute is only valid in Excel 2007 or newer.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFontScheme.None
member.summary: Font is not a theme font and is not linked to the theme. When you change the theme of the spreadsheet, "None" fonts will remain unchanged.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFontScheme.Minor
member.summary: The font is a minor font for the scheme. This is the font that shows (Body) at the right of the font selector box in Excel. Whenever you change the theme of the spreadsheet, all minor fonts in all cells will change to reflect the new minor font in the theme.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFontScheme.Major
member.summary: The font is a major font for the scheme. This is the font that shows (Headings) at the right of the font selector box in Excel. Whenever you change the theme of the spreadsheet, all major fonts in all cells will change to reflect the new major font in the theme.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFont
member.summary: Encapsulation of an Excel Font.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a font with size 10 and name "Arial".

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Name
member.summary: Font name. (For example, "Arial"). Important: When using Excel 2007, if is different from "None", the font scheme takes precedence over the name. If for example Name = "Arial" but Scheme is Major and the major font is Calibri, the font will use Calibri.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Size20
member.summary: Height of the font (in units of 1/20th of a point). A Size20 = 200 means 10 points.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Color
member.summary: Color of the font.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Style
member.summary: Style of the font, such as bold or italics. Underline is a different option.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Underline
member.summary: Underline type.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Family
member.summary: Font family, (see Windows API LOGFONT structure).

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.CharSet
member.summary: Character set. (see Windows API LOGFONT structure)

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Scheme
member.summary:
Font scheme. This only applies to Excel 2007. Note that this property takes over other properties like font name: If the scheme is for example "Major" and the theme has a Major font defined as calibri, then the font will be Calibri no matter if you change the font name.
To manually change the font name, make sure to set Scheme = TFontScheme.None

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat
member.summary: Format for one cell or named style. Cell formats are used to format cells, Named styles to create styles. A Cell format can have a parent style format, even when normally this is null (parent is normal format). Named styles will have a non-null Style property. Cell formats will have style = null.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.CreateStandard2007
member.summary: Returns a standard TFlxFormat for Excel 2007. (Font name is Calibri, etc). You will normally want to use instead of this, since it returns the default format for an specific file, and not a generic format like this.

member.summary: Cell Font.

member.summary: Cell borders.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Format
member.summary:
Format string. (For example, "yyyy-mm-dd" for a date format, or "#.00" for a numeric 2 decimal format)
This format string is the same you use in Excel under "Custom" format when formatting a cell, and it is documented in Excel documentation. Under "Finding out what format string to use in TFlxFormat.Format" section in UsingFlexCelAPI.pdf you can find more detailed information on how to create this string.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Rotation
member.summary:
Text Rotation in degrees.
When this value is from 0 to 90 then this is the rotation degrees in the up direction.
When this value is from 91 to 180 then this is a rotation in the down direction. 91 means -1 degree rotation, 92 means -2 degrees, and so on until 180 which means -90 degrees.
255 is vertical text.
Other values are invalid.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Indent
member.summary: Indent value. (in characters). This value can't be bigger than 15 in Excel 2003 or earlier, and no bigger than 250 in Excel 2007 or newer.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.IsStyle
member.summary: When true this format is a named style, when false a cell format.

member.summary: If true the prefix for the cell is compatible with Lotus 123.

member.summary: Reading order for the cell.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.ParentStyle
member.summary: Name of the Parent style. Normally you will want to keep it at null (parent is normal style), but you can write an existing style here. If is true this property is not used.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.NotNullParentStyle
member.summary: This is similar to but will return "Normal" when the parent is null.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.LinkedStyle
member.summary: If this object holds a Cell format, LinkedStyle specifies which properties of the cell format are linked to its parent style. If this object holds a Style format, LinkedStyle specifies the default set of properties that will be applied when you use this style from Excel.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle
member.summary: This class is used as a part of a class, and stores how a cell format is linked to a style.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.AutomaticChoose
member.summary: When this property is true (the default) FlexCel will automatically choose which linked properties to apply depending on what changes from the base style. For example, if this style has a different font than the basic style, the font will be not linked, and when you change the base style it will keep the same. Excel behaves this way when it adds styles. To manually choose what the format will affect, set this to none. This property doesn't correspond with any Excel property, and it is not stored in the file.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedNumericFormat
member.summary: If true, the numeric format will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the numeric format will not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedFont
member.summary: If true, the font will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the font will not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedAlignment
member.summary: If true, the alignment will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the alignment not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedBorder
member.summary: If true, the border will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the border will not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedFill
member.summary: If true, the fill pattern will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the fill pattern will not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedProtection
member.summary: If true, the protection will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the protection will not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.Assign(FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle)
member.summary: Copies a new style into this object.
member.param: Style with the values to copy.

member.summary: Returns true if the 2 instances have the same data.
member.param: Style with which we want to compare.
member.returns: True if otherStyle has the same values as this object.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.Clone
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of the object.
member.returns: A deep copy of the style. (without any references in common with the original object)

member.summary: Returns true if obj and this object have the same value.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxErr.ErrDatasetDoesntSupportWhere
member.summary: When using LINQ, FlexCel implements filters by calling a "Where(string)" method in the data table. If the table doesn't have a "Where(string)" method, FlexCel can't filter the records.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxErr.ErrInvalidReportRowCount
member.summary: The count of records in a table is different from the actual number of records when reading the data. This means that someone else has inserted or deleted records while this report was running. To avoid this issue, make sure you run the report with isolation level = SNAPSHOT.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxMessage.TxtDefaultTimeAMString
member.summary: Default text to show when AM time string is set to empty on the regional settings dialog from the control panel. When the default is empty, Excel defaults to AM, while .NET defaults to an empty string. As we want to behave the same as Excel, we provide this constant here.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.FlxMessage.TxtDefaultTimePMString
member.summary: Default text to show when PM time string is set to empty on the regional settings dialog from the control panel. When the default is empty, Excel defaults to PM, while .NET defaults to an empty string. As we want to behave the same as Excel, we provide this constant here.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.FlxMessages
member.summary:
FlexCel Native string Constants. It reads the resources from the active locale, and returns the correct string. If your language is not supported and you feel like translating the messages, please send us a copy. We will include it on the next FlexCel version.
To add a new language:
Copy the file flxmsg.resx to your language (for example, flxmsg.es.resx to translate to Spanish)
Edit the new file and change the messages(you can do this visually with visual studio)
Add the .resx file to the FlexCel project

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats
member.summary: Information about characters in a numeric format that need to be adapted when rendering. For example, if the cell A1 has value 1 and format "*_0" it will print as "______1" when the cell is wide, and as "_1" when the cell is shorter.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.WildcardPos
member.summary: Position of the last wildcard ("*") character in the format (0 based). If a wildcard is present in the format, the string has to be expanded with the character at position until it fits the width of the cell. A negative value means there is no wildcard in the format.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.Separators
member.summary: An array of positions and characters that must be used to pad the string. In this field you have the the "_" and "?" numeric format delimeters from Excel. The spaces at the positions in the position array should have the width of the character specified in this field. If null, there are no separators in this class.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns true if this class has no adaptative formats.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.ApplySeparators(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the string with the characters at the positions in Separator changed by the characters specified in Separators.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.AddSeparator(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a separator at a given position. Separator array will be kept in order when you add a value. This routine considers utf32 characters.
member.param: String with the characters.
Position in the format string. (0 based)
Position in the final string. (0 based)

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.AddSeparator(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a char separator at a given position. Separator array will be kept in order when you add a value.
member.param: Character that will be used to calculate the width of the string.
Position in the final string. (0 based)

member.summary: Static class to convert cells to formatted strings. It uses format strings from Excel, that are different to those on .net, so we have to try to reconcile the diffs.

member.summary: Returns the string used on a standard date on the current locale

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TFlxNumberFormat.RegionalDateTimeString
member.summary: Returns the string used on a standard date and time on the current locale

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TFlxNumberFormat.FormatValue(System.Object,System.String,FlexCel.Core.ExcelFile)
member.summary: Formats a value as it would be shown by Excel.
member.param: Value to format.

Cell Format. (For example, "yyyy-mm-dd" for a date format, or "#.00" for a numeric 2 decimal format)
This format string is the same you use in Excel under "Custom" format when formatting a cell, and it is documented in Excel documentation. Under "Finding out what format string to use in TFlxFormat.Format" section in UsingFlexCelAPI.pdf you can find more detailed information on how to create this string.
Workbook with the cell. If null, no color information will be returned and the base date fill be assumed to be 1900 (windows) and not 1904 (macs).

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TFlxNumberFormat.FormatValue(System.Object,System.String,FlexCel.Core.TUIColor@,FlexCel.Core.ExcelFile,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Formats a value as it would be shown by Excel.
member.param: Value to format.

Cell Format. (For example, "yyyy-mm-dd" for a date format, or "#.00" for a numeric 2 decimal format)
This format string is the same you use in Excel under "Custom" format when formatting a cell, and it is documented in Excel documentation. Under "Finding out what format string to use in TFlxFormat.Format" section in UsingFlexCelAPI.pdf you can find more detailed information on how to create this string.
Final color of the text. (Depending on the format, color might change. I.e. Red for negatives)
Workbook with the cell. If null, no color information will be returned and the base date fill be assumed to be 1900 (windows) and not 1904 (macs).
Returns if the format contains a date.
Returns if the format contains a time.
member.returns: Formatted string.

Cell format.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection
member.summary: This enum contains the possible values that can go into a structured reference. You can combine multiple values, but not all combinations make sense. For example #Data + #Headers it fine, but #All + #Headers is just #All.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.None
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.All
member.summary: The structured reference applies to the whole table. This is equivalent to [#All].

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.Headers
member.summary: The structured reference applies to the headers of the table. This is equivalent to [#Headers].

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.Data
member.summary: The structured reference applies to data (all the table without headers or totals) of the table. This is equivalent to [#Data].

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.Totals
member.summary: The structured reference applies to the totals row of the table. This is equivalent to [#Totals].

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.ThisRow
member.summary: The structured reference applies to the row of the table where the reference is. This is equivalent to @ or [#This row].

member.summary: Represents a font used for drawing in a pdf/gdi+/wpf/winrt canvas. This class might hold resources which need disposing.

member.summary: Creates a font with the given name and size.
member.param: Name of the font.
Size in points of the font.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TUIFont.Create(System.String,System.Double,FlexCel.Core.TUIFontStyle)
member.summary: Creates a font with the given name, size and style.
member.param: Name of the font.
Size in points of the font.
Style of the font (italic, bold, etc)

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TUIFont.CreateFromMemory(System.Byte[],System.Double,FlexCel.Core.TUIFontStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates a font from the font data. IMPORTANT NOTE: When using GDI+ (default in Windows), this method will create a FontCollection that can never be disposed until the application exits.
When using GDI+, try not to use this method, or make sure that it is called only a couple of times since the memory for the loaded font won't be released. On the other hand, calling this method multiple times with the same font is ok, FlexCel will cache the font and not create multiple instances.
member.param: Byte array containing the ttf font data.
Size in points of the font.
Style of the font (italic, bold, etc)
Index of the font

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TUIFont.CreateFromFile(System.String,System.Double,FlexCel.Core.TUIFontStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates a font from a font file. IMPORTANT NOTE: When using GDI+ (default in Windows), this method will create a FontCollection that can never be disposed until the application exits.
When using GDI+, try not to use this method, or make sure that it is called only a couple of times since the memory for the loaded font won't be released. On the other hand, calling this method multiple times with the same font is ok, FlexCel will cache the font and not create multiple instances.
member.param: Filename of the file containing the ttf font data.
Size in points of the font.
Style of the font (italic, bold, etc)
Index of the font

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TUIFont.CreateSimilarFont(System.String,System.Double,FlexCel.Core.TUIFontStyle)
member.summary: Creates a font which is the most similar to the one you specify. Some fonts don't have specific styles like italics or bold, if this is the case, this method will return the same font with a different style.
member.param: Name of the font we wish to create.
Size in points of the font.
Style of the font.
member.returns: The font if it was possible to create it, or a similar one if it wasn't.

member.summary: Disposes this instance.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TUIFont.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Override this method to dispose your own objects in your descending classes.
member.param: If true, this is a direct call to Dispose(), and you need to dispose both managed and unmanaged resources. If false, this is called by the finalizer, and you only need to release unmanaged resources.

member.name: E:FlexCel.Core.TUIFont.FontCreating
member.summary: Fires before a font is created. You can customize the font properties and create a different font instead. Note that this event is static and it applies to the whole app.

member.name: E:FlexCel.Core.TUIFont.FontCreated
member.summary:
Fires after a font has been created. You can use this event to handle fonts that don't exist in your system and are replaced by a different font by the OS. Note that this event is static and it applies to the whole app.
Remark: As this event fires after the font has been created, it means that if you modify it the font is created twice. It is not going to have a big impact in performance, but if possible use the event instead, as it won't cause the font to be created twice. This event has to be used only for cases where you want to override the default operating system font substitution algorithm.

member.summary: Replace this event when creating a custom descendant of TUIFont.

member.summary: Replace this event when creating a custom descendant of TUIFont.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the event arguments with the specified parameters.
member.param: Name of the final font as decided by the operating system. Note that some operating systems might return the same name as the original font even if they used a substitute font under the hood. In those platforms we can't know a font has been substituted.

Size in points of the font.

member.summary: Name of the font we were trying to create. This property is readonly, to change it change instead.

member.summary: Creates a UIGraphics from a given System.Drawing.Graphics. Important: When you do an implicit conversion, the TUIBrush will take ownership of the brush, and the original System.Drawing.Brush will be disposed when you dispose this class.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TUIGraphics.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes this instance.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TUIGraphics.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Override this method to dispose your own objects in your descending classes.
member.param: If true, this is a direct call to Dispose(), and you need to dispose both managed and unmanaged resources. If false, this is called by the finalizer, and you only need to release unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TMultipartType
member.summary: Different ways to define a multipart archive.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TMultipartType.Related
member.summary: Parts inside this container are related, for example this message could contain an HTML file and its external images.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TMultipartType.Alternative
member.summary: Parts inside this container are an alternative one from the other. For example, a message could be sent in HTML and plain Text, once inside a different MIME part, and the mail reader should chose the best alternative of the parts to display.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TMultipartType.Mixed
member.summary: Parts inside this MIME container are not related, e.g. different attachments.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TMultipartType.Digest
member.summary: A compilation of messages, used in forwarded emails.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TMultipartType.Signed
member.summary: A part containing files and one signature.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: Defines how a part of a MIME message will be coded.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TContentTransferEncoding.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Use the Quoted Printable algorithm (RFC 2045 section 6.7). You will normally use this encoding for text. When using this option, you need to write the part content using or a similar method.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TContentTransferEncoding.Base64
member.summary: Use base64 algorithm (RFC 2045 section 6.7). You would normally use this encoding for binary files. When using this option, you need to write the part content using or a similar method.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TQEncodeMetaInfo
member.summary: Defines how a string returned by Q-Encode will be handled.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TQEncodeMetaInfo.None
member.summary: This will return the raw Q-Encoded string, without "=?charset?encoding?" at the beginning or "?=" at the end.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TQEncodeMetaInfo.Always
member.summary: This will always return the Q-Encoded string with "=?charset?encoding?" at the beginning and "?=" at the end.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TQEncodeMetaInfo.OnlyIfNeeded
member.summary: This will return the string with "=?charset?encoding?" only if the original string has special characters that need encoding, if not it will return the original string without encoding.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter
member.summary: A simple class used to create MIME formatted messages. While it does not provide much functionality, it gives enough to create simple multipart archives.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.CreateMultiPartMessage(System.IO.TextWriter,FlexCel.Core.TMultipartType,System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates the headers for a multipart MIME file. This must be the first method to call in order to create a MIME file. After this, you need to call and start adding the parts of the message, and you always need to end the message by calling .
member.param: Type of multipart for this file.
Type of the header as defined in the MIME standard, e.g. "text/plain", "text/html", etc. This is the type of the main part on a related message. Set it to null if there is no main part.
The location for the whole mime file. null if you do not want to set a location. for this to work in ie/opera, etc, this should be something like "file:///filename.ext"

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.AddPartHeader(System.IO.TextWriter,System.String,FlexCel.Core.TContentTransferEncoding,System.Uri,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the header for a part in a multipart Mime message. After calling this method, you need to write your data content into the TextWriter using or and after that always call .
member.param: TextWriter where you are saving the message.
Type of the header as defined in the MIME standard, e.g. "text/plain", "text/html", etc.
How the part will be codified. Use base64 for binary TextWriter and quotedprintable for text.
The location for this resource. null if you do not want to set a location.

Content id of the resource, if you want to use it in cid: links. Null if you do not want to specify a content-id. Note that this string will not be escaped by the framework, so make sure it contains valid characters. As it needs to be globally unique, normally a GUID can be a good option here.
Name for the encoding on this part. Null means do not write an encoding. (for example in binary parts)

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.EndPart(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Ends a MIME part started with .
member.param: TextWriter where you are saving the message.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.EndMultiPartMessage(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Call this method after the last call to EndPart, to finish the MIME message.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.QEncode(System.String,FlexCel.Core.TQEncodeMetaInfo)
member.summary: Returns the Q-encode of a string, used in the MIME Headers. //RFC 2047
member.param: String to encode
Defines if to add the string "=?charset?encoding?" will be appended at the begining, and "?=" at the end.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.WriteQuotedPrintable(System.IO.TextWriter,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the Quoted Printable encoding of a string, as defined in RFC 2045 section 6.7 This method keeps state and breaks the line every time it is longer than 76 characters. The state is reset each time is called.
member.param: TextWriter where we will write the data.
String to Encode.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.WriteBase64(System.IO.TextWriter,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes the base64 encoding of a byte array, as defined in RFC 2045 section 6.8 This method does not keep the state, so all binary data must be supplied at once. As an alternative you could use System.Convert.ToBase64String(byte[], int, int), but this method avoids creating a temporary string, and then doubling the memory needed for the encoding. This method will also correctly split the string at 76 characters, while Convert.ToBase64 in .NET 1.1 will not. (2.0 added this support)
member.param: TextWriter where we will write the data.
String to Encode.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TClientAnchor.ChildAnchor
member.summary: Returns the offset on the parent system for the image, when it is grouped. For example, if the parent shape on the group is 100 px wide, and ChildAnchor has a dx of 0.5, the image starts 50px to the right of the parent. If the shape is not grouped or it is the shape on top of the group, ChildAnchor is null. When this member is not null, other values on ClientAnchor have no meaning.

member.summary: This method will create an anchor so the image keeps its aspect ratio, and it is contained inside the group of cells. If you supply negative values for Col2 or Row2, then those values will be ignored. If you set Col2 negative, then this method will place the image between Row1 and Row2, and calculate Col2 so the image keeps its aspect ratio. Similar if you set Row2 negative.
member.param: Image that you want to insert. It is used to know its dimensions and dpi.
How the image behaves when copying/inserting cells.
First Row of object.
Delta y of image on 1/255 of a cell. 0 means totally at the top, 128 on half of the cell, 255 means at the top of next cell.
First column of object.

Last row of object.Set it to 0 or negative for unlimited rows.
Delta y of image on 1/255 of a cell. 0 means totally at the top, 128 on half of the cell, 255 means at the top of next cell.
Last column of object.Set it to 0 or negative for unlimited columns.
Delta x of image, on 1/1024 of a cell. 0 means totally at the left, 512 on half of the cell, 1024 means at the left of next cell.
How the image will be fit inside the range of cells.
How the image will be fit inside the range of cells.
ExcelFile with the workbook, used to calculate the cells.

member.param: Name of the range.
Sheet index for the sheet that holds the range. 0 means a global range (default on Excel)
Sheet index where the range apply. This is where row and col properties apply, not where the range is stored. (1-based)
First row on range.
First column on range.
Last row on range.
Last column on range.
Options of this Range.

The formula for the range, expressed as text. Use it if the range is complex and cannot be expressed with aSheetIndex, aFirstRow... etc When you specify this parameter, all SheetIndex, aFirstRow, etc. lose their meaning.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new Named range with the given values. Use this overload to create a simple range.
member.param: Name of the range.
Sheet index for the sheet that holds the range. 0 means a global range (default on Excel)

First row on range.

Last column on range.
Options of this Range.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a complex Named range, with a formula.
member.param: Name of the range.
Sheet index for the sheet that holds the range. 0 means a global range (default on Excel)
Options of this Range.

The formula for the range, expressed as text. For example: "A1:B2,C3:C7"
Note that with relative references, we always consider "A1" to be the cell where the name is. This means that the formula: "=$A$1 + A1" when evaluated in Cell B8, will read "=$A$1 + B8". To provide a negative offset, you need to wrap the formula. For example "=A1048575" will evaluate to B7 when evaluated in B8.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty NamedRange.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.Name
member.summary: The name of the range.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.SheetIndex
member.summary: The Sheet index where the row and col properties apply. 1-based. When RangeFormula is set, it is not used.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.NameSheetIndex
member.summary: The sheet index for the name (1 based). A named range can have the same name than other as long as they are on different sheets. The default value(0) means a global named range, not tied to any specific sheet.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.OptionFlags
member.summary:
Options of the range. You can access the options by using the corresponding properties. (Hidden, BuiltIn, etc).
You can use this property to set them all at the same time.
You can get the properties by OR'ing the following values:
01. Name is hidden. Corresponds to the property .
02. Name is a function. Corresponds to the property .
04. Name is a VB procedure. If set you also need to set 08 (name is a macro). Corresponds to the property .
08. Name is a Macro. Corresponds to the property .
16. Name returns an Array. Corresponds to the property .
32. Name is a BuiltIn name (like Print_Area). Corresponds to the property .
8192. Name will be published when exporting to html. Corresponds to the property .
16384. Indicates that the name is used as a workbook parameter on a version of the workbook that is published to or rendered on a Web or application server. Corresponds to the property .

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.RangeFormula
member.summary:
This is a formula defining the range. It can be used to define complex ranges. For example you can use "=Sheet1!$A:$B,Sheet1!$1:$2". When this parameter is set, SheetIndex, Left, Top, Right and Bottom properties have no meaning.
Note that with relative references, we always consider "A1" to be the cell where the name is. This means that the formula: "=$A$1 + A1" when evaluated in Cell B8, will read "=$A$1 + B8". To provide a negative offset, you need to wrap the formula. For example "=A1048575" will evaluate to B7 when evaluated in B8.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.Hidden
member.summary: True if the range is hidden.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.Function
member.summary: True if the range is a function.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.VisualBasicProc
member.summary: True if the range is a Visual Basic Procedure

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.Proc
member.summary: True if the range is a function on a macro sheet.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.CalcExp
member.summary: True if the range contains a complex function.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.BuiltIn
member.summary: True if the range is a built in name. Built in names are 1 char long.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.FunctionGroup
member.summary: Specifies the function group index if the defined name refers to a function. The function group defines the general category for the function. This attribute is used when there is an add-in or other code project associated with the file.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.PublishToServer
member.summary: Indicates whether the defined name is included in the version of the workbook that is published to or rendered on a Web or application server. This is new to Excel 2007.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.WorkbookParameter
member.summary: Indicates that the name is used as a workbook parameter on a version of the workbook that is published to or rendered on a Web or application server. This is new to Excel 2007.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.Comment
member.summary: Returns the comment associated with the name, if there is one. Comments are only available in Excel 2007, but they are saved too in xls file format.

member.summary: Returns true if the string can be a cell reference, like A1 or LVM78, or "R", "C", "TRUE" or "FALSE". If this method returns true, you can't name a sheet or a named range with name.

member.summary: Returns "A" for column 1, "B" for 2 and so on.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TCellAddress.DecodeColumn(System.String)
member.summary: Returns 1 for column "A", 2 for "B" and so on. If the string isn't a valid column name, this method will return -1. You normally will just want to create TCellAddress to convert between cell references (var cell = new TCellAddress(row, col); DoSomething(cell.CellRef). But this method could be used in specific cases where you want only the column string and not the full address.
member.param: String which defines a column.
member.returns: -1 if col can't be converted to a column reference, or the column number (1 based) otherwise.

member.summary: Cell address in Excel A1 notation. (For example "A5"). Absolute references ($A$5) will work too.

member.summary: Returns the cell reference in the objects in R1C1 notation.
member.param: Row where the cell that has the formula is. This is used in relative R1C1 references, so for example, if the cell with the formula is B7, and this object holds a relative C9, the result would be R[2]C[1]

Column where the cell that has the formula is. This is used in relative R1C1 references, so for example, if the cell with the formula is B7, and this object holds a relative C9, the result would be R[2]C[1]
member.returns: The cell reference in R1C1 notation.

member.summary: Tries to set a cell reference, and returns true if the cell is a correct A1 reference. This is similar to setting to a string, but it will not raise an exception.
member.param: String with the cell reference, in A1 format. To use R1C1 notation, see
member.returns: True if value was a correct cell reference, false otherwise.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TCellAddress.TryParseSheet(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Parses a string like Sheet1!A1 into a sheet component and the rest. If the sheet is quoted ('sheet 1') it will be unquoted.
member.param: String to parse
Part of the string that is the sheet.
Part of the string that is not the sheet.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TCellAddress.TrySetCellRef(System.String,FlexCel.Core.TReferenceStyle,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tries to set a cell reference, and returns true if the cell is a correct A1 or R1C1 reference.
member.param: String with the cell reference, in A1 or R1C1 format.
Style the reference is in (A1 or R1C1).

Row where the cell is. This is only used for R1C1 relative references, to know where the cell is. For example, the reference R[1]C[1] when cellRow is 5 will reference row 6. A1 references or absolute R1C1 references ignore this parameter.

Column where the cell is. This is only used for R1C1 relative references, to know where the cell is. For example, the reference R[1]C[1] when cellCol is 5 will reference column 6. A1 references or absolute R1C1 references ignore this parameter.
member.returns: True if value was a correct cell reference, false otherwise.

member.summary: Creates a new TFormulaSpan and sets its values.
member.param: How many rows the formula will use.
How many columns the formula will use.

Indicates if this is the first formula of the array. Only the formula that is at the top left cell of the group will be used when setting a formula. Other formulas will be ignored, so you can copy formulas in a loop from one place to the other without worring if the cell is at the top left or not.

member.summary: Indicates if this is the first formula of the array. Only the formula that is at the top left cell of the group will be used when setting a formula. member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TRichString
member.summary: A string cell value with its rich text information. RTFRuns is an array of TRTFRun structures, where each struct identifies a font style for a portion of text. For example, if you have: Value = "Hello" RTFRuns = {FirstChar:1 FontIndex=1, FirstChar=3, FontIndex=2} "H" (char 0) will be formatted with the specific cell format. "el" (chars 1 and 2) will have font number 1 "lo" (chars 3 and 4) will have font number 2

Array of TRTFRuns structs. This value will be COPIED, so old reference is not used
Workbook containing the fonts.

Rich string with the RTF values to copy. This value will be COPIED, so old reference is not used
How many characters the RTFRun must be moved. For example: RichString(s.SubString(3), RTFRuns, 3) will adapt the RTFRun for s to the new substring.

member.param: Html string we want to convert.

Original format of the cell where we want to enter the string. Note that depending on the starting cell, the Rich string will be different. For example, if you have a cell with Red text and add a "hello <b> world" string, then resulting RichString will include a RED bold "world" string
File where this string will be added.

member.summary: Concatenates two TRichString objects. Be careful that formats will be preserved from s1 to s2. If s1 ends up in red, s2 will start with red too. If you want to avoid this, make sure s2 has a font definition at character 0. ALSO, MAKE SURE YOU ARE CONCATENATING RICH STRINGS FROM THE SAME WORKBOOK, SO FONT INDEXES ARE SIMILAR.

Second string to concatenate.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TEncryptionType
member.summary: How the file is encrypted. This applies only to xls files. Xlsx files are encrypted using the Agile xlsx encryption.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TEncryptionType.Xor
member.summary: Excel 95 XOR encryption.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TEncryptionType.Standard
member.summary: Excel 97/2000 encryption.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TEncryptionType.Strong
member.summary: Excel XP/2003 encryption. Note that despite the name, this mode has multiple known vulnerabilities and it is just marginally better than TEncryptionType.Standard. Both use RC4 algorithm to encrypt, which is weak. If you need files to be really secure, you need to use xlsx (which supports AES), not xls.

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Encryption algorithms supported in xlsx encrypted files.

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TEncryptionAlgorithm.AES_128
member.summary: AES 128. This is the default in Excel 2007/2010

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TEncryptionAlgorithm.AES_192
member.summary: AES 192

member.name: F:FlexCel.Core.TEncryptionAlgorithm.AES_256
member.summary: AES 256

member.name: T:FlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange
member.summary: Specifies a protected range in a sheet. You can define those ranges in Excel 2007 by going to "Review" tab and selecting "Allow Users to Edit Ranges" In Excel 2003, they are available under "Menu->Tools->Protection".

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty protected range.

member.name: M:FlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.#ctor(System.String,System.String,FlexCel.Core.TXlsCellRange[])
member.summary: Creates and initializes a protected range.
member.param: Name for the protected range.
Password to modify the cells. Keep it null if you don't want to set a password.
Ranges of cells where this protected range applies. You might pass an array of TXlsCellRanges here or just a single TXlsCellRange object.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.Password
member.summary: Password used to protect the range. Use empty or null to have no password. Note: As this password is not saved in the file, when you open a file this property will be empty. You can know if a file has a password by looking at . Setting this property will set the property using the current .

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.PasswordHash
member.summary: This is the hash for the password that is stored in the file. You shouldn't set this property directly unless you are copying the hash from other place. When you set this property, will be reset.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Returns the encryption algorithm used to encrypt the password hash.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.Ranges
member.summary: Ranges of cells this protection applies to. You can specify more than one range of cells for the same ProtectedRange.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.Name
member.summary: Name of the protected range.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.SecurityDescriptorXLSX
member.summary: Returns the security descriptor of the protected range, for XLSX files. This is a string used if you are giving permissions to some users in the range. Note that because of the different security descriptor formats, FlexCel won't convert between security descriptors from xls and xlsx. Take a look at APIMate to see the descriptor of a particular file.

member.name: P:FlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.SecurityDescriptorXLS
member.summary: Returns the security descriptor of the protected range, for XLS files. This is a byte array encapsulating a Windows Security Descriptor, and it is used if you are giving permissions to some users in the range. Note that because of the different security descriptor formats, FlexCel won't convert between security descriptors from xls and xlsx. Take a look at APIMate to see the descriptor of a particular file.

member.summary: Returns a deep copy of the object.

member.summary: Returns true if the 2 objects have the same contents.
